author: Redacción
title: Centro de estudios digestivos HOMS ofrece curso de endoscopía terapéutica a médicos residentes
text: Santiago.- El Centro de Estudios Digestivos del Hospital Metropolitano de Santiago (HOMS), llevó a cabo los días 1 y 2 de noviembre el Curso Teórico Práctico de Endoscopía Terapéutica, dirigido a los médicos residentes de último año de todas las escuelas de Gastroenterología del país. La doctora Brígida Navarro de Sánchez, directora del centro, explicó que el objetivo fundamental de este entrenamiento es eficientizar el conocimiento y las habilidades técnicas de los próximos gastroenterólogos, basado en la ciencia y el humanismo. Asimismo, la dirección del curso estuvo a cargo del doctor Damián Tavares, encargado de la Unidad de vías biliares y páncreas del Centro de Estudios Digestivos (CED), y contó con la destacada participación del doctor Carlos Micames, de Puerto Rico; los doctores Fernando Contreras, Sterling Díaz y Carlos Cueto, de Santo Domingo; todos ellos expertos en endoscopía terapéutica avanzada. RECOMENDAMOS LEER: De parte del CED tuvieron una participación además los doctores Christie Perelló, Rebeca De León, Mario Peralta, Masiel Rosario y Miguel Contreras. “Estas actividades se realizan con frecuencia en el [HOMS ](https://cdn.com.do/nacionales/curan-primer-paciente-con-enfermedad-de-parkinson-en-el-homs/)como parte de su compromiso con la educación médica continua, ya que es un centro de salud docente. En este curso los médicos residentes pudieron realizar polipectomías, manejo de estenosis, ligadura de varices, tratamiento de sangrado digestivo, entre otros, en especímenes porcinos”, explicó la doctora Navarro. Finalmente, la realización del curso contó con la colaboración de Fuji Film, empresa japonesa fabricante de endoscopios, Seminsa, casa distribuidora de los equipos en el país y con el aval de la Pontificia Universidad Católica Madre y Maestra y la Sociedad Dominicana de Gastroenterología. LE PUEDE INTERESAR: También, Fuji Film, mostró por primera vez en Latinoamérica el simulador Mikoto, donde los doctores pudieron medir sus habilidades en la realización de colonoscopía. Sobre el HOMS El [HOMS](https://homs.com.do/), es pionero en República Dominicana en intervenciones quirúrgicas con robótica y posee la certificación internacional de Accreditation Canada (ACI) como garantía de la seguridad y calidad asistencial, posicionándose como líder en turismo de salud de la zona norte del país.

organizations.name: Curso Teórico Práctico de Endoscopía Terapéutica

text:

VER RESUMEN
El volante de Colo Colo, Tomás Alarcón, se lesionó en amistoso contra La Roja Sub 20, podría perderse el clásico contra Universidad Católica y el Superclásico ante La U. Si la lesión no mejora, se perderá importantes partidos.

author: Cision
title: JinkoSolar is the First PV Company Worldwide with Net-zero Targets Approved by the Science Based Targets initiative | Kalkine Media
text: SHANGRAO, China, Dec. 29, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- JinkoSolar Holding Co., Ltd. ("JinkoSolar" or the "Company") (NYSE: JKS), one of the largest and most innovative solar module manufacturers in the world, today announced that the near and long-term science-based emissions reduction targets* of its principle subsidiary Jinko Solar Co., Ltd., have recently been approved by the SBTi, making JinkoSolar the first PV company in the world to have its Net-zero targets validated. It is only the second company in mainland China to achieve that status, as well as the third company in the global semi-conductor industry. The Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) is a global body enabling businesses to set ambitious emissions reductions targets in line with the latest climate science. It is focused on accelerating companies across the world to halve emissions before 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions before 2050. In the era of global warming, participating in and setting science-based targets has become a new business norm, reflecting the competitiveness and responsibility of companies in the fields of sustainable development and ESG. Currently, over 7,000 companies worldwide have committed to the SBTi, including Tesla, Apple, BASF, Lenovo, and Tencent. In late 2019, JinkoSolar announced its participation in the RE100 green initiative and, at the end of 2021, Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. officially committed to set net-zero targets in line with climate science with the SBTi. In the first half of 2023, Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. released its 2022 ESG report, outlining its climate roadmap for the first time. Leveraging its consistently innovative PV technology and reliable PV products, JinkoSolar provides clean, secure, affordable, and renewable electricity globally. It addresses global climate change with an economic, green, and feasible approach. In the fourth quarter of 2023, JinkoSolar became the first PV company to have delivered a total of more than 200 GW of solar modules. Accordingly, IHS Markit estimates that one out of every eight modules in the world today was manufactured by JinkoSolar, contributing 1 kilogram of carbon reduction for every 8 kilograms of PV products. By working with SBTi and setting net-zero targets, JinkoSolar is not only declaring its ambition to address climate change but also providing a clear action guide for full value chain emissions reduction. JinkoSolar is fully committed to play its part in the global energy transformation and contribute to building a greener and more sustainable future. *The SBTi plans to publish Jinko Solar Co., Ltd.'s approved net-zero target on their website on the 25th of January 2024. About JinkoSolar Holding Co., Ltd. JinkoSolar (NYSE: JKS) is one of the largest and most innovative solar module manufacturers in the world. JinkoSolar distributes its solar products and sells its solutions and services to a diversified international utility, commercial and residential customer base in China, the United States, Japan, Germany, the United Kingdom, Chile, South Africa, India, Mexico, Brazil, the United Arab Emirates, Italy, Spain, France, Belgium, Netherlands, Poland, Austria, Switzerland, Greece and other countries and regions. JinkoSolar had 14 productions facilities globally, 24 overseas subsidiaries in Japan, South Korea, Vietnam, India, Turkey, Germany, Italy, Switzerland, the United States, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Australia, Canada, Malaysia, the United Arab Emirates, Denmark, Indonesia, Nigeria and Saudi Arabia, and global sales teams in China, the United States, Canada, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Italy, Germany, Turkey, Spain, Japan, the United Arab Emirates, Netherlands, Vietnam and India, as of September 30, 2023. To find out more, please see: www.jinkosolar.com Safe Harbor Statement This press release contains forward-looking statements. These statements constitute "forward-looking" statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and as defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These forward-looking statements can be identified by terminology such as "will," "expects," "anticipates," "future," "intends," "plans," "believes," "estimates" and similar statements. Among other things, the quotations from management in this press release and the Company's operations and business outlook, contain forward-looking statements. Such statements involve certain risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those in the forward-looking statements. Further information regarding these and other risks is included in JinkoSolar's filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, including its annual report on Form 20-F. Except as required by law, the Company does not undertake any obligation to update any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. author: Matteo Lignelli
title: Il Mediterraneo sale a velocità tripla: costa toscana a rischio inondazioni | Corriere.it
text: Il Mediterraneo sale a velocità tripla: costa toscana a rischio inondazioni Il livello del mare aumenterà di un metro entro la fine del secolo e l'erosione colpisce in particolare la costa da Marina di Massa a Pietrasanta La Toscane è tra le aree che si affacciano sul Mediterraneo in cui il livello del mare sta salendo a velocità tripla rispetto alle stime fatte finora. Secondo uno studio firmato da tre ricercatori italiani delle sedi di Roma e Bologna dell'Istituto Nazionale di Geofisica e Vulcanologia (Ingv) e dell'Università olandese di Radboud, nel Mediterraneo ci sono 38.500 chilometri quadrati di costa che saranno presto a rischio inondazione. La maggior parte tra Egitto (12.879 km2), Italia (10.060 km2) e Francia (3.681 km2). Le zone più a rischio, dicono i ricercatori, sono quelle di Friuli Venezia-Giulia, Veneto, Emilia-Romagna e Puglia settentrionale per il versante adriatico; e quelle di Toscana, Lazio e in parte della Sardegna per quello tirrenico. La causa della modifica al rialzo delle proiezioni è da ricercare nel fenomeno della «subsidenza», cioè «il lento movimento verso il basso del suolo dovuto a cause naturali o antropiche» che ha «un ruolo cruciale nell'accelerare l'aumento del livello del mare lungo le coste, innescato dal riscaldamento globale a partire dal 1880», osserva Marco Anzidei dell'Ingv. «Le nostre analisi mostrano che, proprio a causa della subsidenza, in alcune zone del Mediterraneo il livello del mare sta aumentando a una velocità quasi tripla rispetto alle zone stabili» aggiunge Antonio Vecchio dell'Università di Radboud e primo autore della ricerca. «Nelle aree risultate più a rischio ci saranno maggiori impatti sull'ambiente, sulle attività umane e sulle infrastrutture, quindi è necessario intraprendere azioni concrete a sostegno delle popolazioni costiere». In Toscana i numeri non erano confortanti. Come riporta il rapporto Spiagge 2023 di Legambiente, il livello del mare aumenterà di un metro entro la fine del secolo. Ma va considerata anche l’erosione costiera, che dal 2006 al 2019 ha modificato 110 chilometri di costa, ovvero il 38% del totale, e di questi sono 40 i chilometri spariti. Anche se, per fortuna, la nostra non è tra le regioni in cui l’erosione ha superato la porzione di costa in avanzamento, ci sono situazioni critiche nell’arco che va da Marina di Massa a Pietrasanta. Le [cause sono diverse, dai cambiamenti climatici alla cementificazione](https://corrierefiorentino.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/23_novembre_10/bisognera-imparare-a-prevenire-le-alluvioni-e-a-gestire-bene-l-acqua-durante-la-siccita-il-clima-e-cambiato-anche-in-toscana-b21897a5-e7e8-435b-a7eb-52c9e7ffexlk.shtml) sfrenata fino ai tassi record di occupazione delle spiagge (il 52,7% è in concessione, dieci punti sopra la media nazionale). I casi più difficili sono a Marina di Massa Ronchi, Partaccia e Poveromo. Proprio in questi giorni nella sede di Carrara della Camera di Commercio Toscana Nord-Ovest, è stato trovato l’accordo per l’attuazione di un importante intervento di manutenzione e contrasto dei fenomeni erosivi del sistema costiero apuo-versiliese, firmato dal governatore Eugenio Giani, dai sindaci e dalle autorità locali. La newsletter Se vuoi restare aggiornato sulle notizie di Firenze iscriviti gratis alla newsletter del Corriere Fiorentino. Arriva tutti i giorni direttamente nella tua casella di posta alle 12. [Basta cliccare qui](https://www.corriere.it/newsletter/?theme=45) 29 dicembre 2023 ( modifica il 29 dicembre 2023 | 16:33) © RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: Reuters
title: Oil rises $1 on new US sanctions
text:
Oil prices rose more than $1 a barrel on Wednesday on concerns about global supplies after Washington issued new sanctions targeting Chinese importers of Iranian oil.
Brent crude futures rose $1.06, or 1.64%, to $65.73 a barrel by 1618 GMT while US WTI crude rose $1.02, or 1.66%, to $62.35.
The US on Wednesday issued new sanctions targeting Iran's oil exports, including against a China-based "teapot refinery", as Trump seeks to ramp up pressure on Tehran, and drive Iranian oil exports down to zero.
The action comes as the US government has relaunched negotiations with Iran over its nuclear programme this month. Meanwhile, Iran's right to enrich uranium is not negotiable, Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Wednesday ahead of the next round of talks in Rome on Saturday. OPEC has received updated plans for Iraq, Kazakhstan and other countries to make further oil output cuts to compensate for pumping above agreed quotas, the group said on Wednesday.

author: AB Newswire
title: Leading Provider of Innovative Beverage Pasteurization Solutions, Prowm, Revolutionizes the Industry | Markets | bigspringherald.com
text:
Milwaukee, WI - Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. is a leading provider of innovative beverage pasteurization solutions, is pleased to announce the compelling advantages of their state-of-the-art Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers for co-packing companies looking to enhance their operations.
In today's competitive co-packing industry, quality and efficiency are paramount. With consumers demanding fresher, safer, and more consistently delicious products, co-packing companies are continually seeking ways to meet these expectations. Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. has recognized this need and developed a range of cutting-edge Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers that offer unparalleled benefits for co-packers.
Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc.'s Tunnel Pasteurizers are designed to heat-treat a wide range of beverages including beer, tea, coffee, hard seltzers and more. These systems ensure that products maintain their quality, taste, and nutritional value while meeting the strictest safety standards. Tunnel Pasteurizers from Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. enable co-packing companies to:
Enhance Product Safety: The precise temperature control in Tunnel Pasteurizers eliminates harmful microorganisms, ensuring products are safe for consumers, meet regulatory requirements, and extends shelf life. Improve Quality: Maintaining product quality and taste is crucial. Our pasteurizers achieve this by minimizing the thermal impact on sensitive products, preserving their freshness and flavor. Boost Efficiency: With Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc.'s Tunnel Pasteurizers, co-packers can increase their production throughput while reducing labor costs. These systems are designed for optimal efficiency. Expand Product Portfolio: Co-packing companies can diversify their offerings by confidently pasteurizing various products, including those with different packaging formats. In addition to Tunnel Pasteurizers, Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. offers Batch Pasteurizers, which are ideal for smaller batch sizes and specialized products. These versatile systems provide co-packers with the flexibility to experiment with new recipes, develop seasonal items, and cater to niche markets, all while maintaining quality and safety.
Since 1977, Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. has had a long-standing reputation for delivering robust, reliable, and innovative customized beverage equipment. Their Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers are no exception. Co-packing companies seeking to stay competitive, meet consumer demands, and expand their product offerings should consider partnering with Pro to implement these advanced pasteurization solutions.
For more information about Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. and their Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers, please visit: https://prowm.com/co-packing-companies-expanding-new-tunnel-batch-pasteurizer/
About Pro:
Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. is a trusted provider of beverage pasteurizers and solutions, specializing in pasteurization systems, conveyor systems, and more. With a commitment to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, Pro has been a preferred partner for companies in the beverage industry for since 1977.

author: Redacción Portafolio
title: Innovador tratamiento para el cáncer de cuello uterino reduce notablemente el riesgo de muerte | Regiones | Economía | Portafolio
text:
Un estudio reciente ha mostrado que la incorporación de un tratamiento de quimioterapia de seis semanas al protocolo estándar para el cáncer de cuello uterino localmente avanzado puede aumentar significativamente las tasas de supervivencia.
(Vea: Victor Ambros y Gary Ruvkun ganan el premio Nobel de Medicina )
De acuerdo con CNN, la investigación, publicada en la revista The Lancet, incluyó a 500 pacientes de 32 centros médicos en Brasil, India, Italia, México y el Reino Unido entre 2012 y 2022.
Los participantes, todos diagnosticados con cáncer de cuello uterino en etapa avanzada y sin tumores metastásicos, fueron asignados aleatoriamente a dos grupos. El grupo de control recibió quimiorradioterapia estándar, que combina radiación y el medicamento cisplatino, mientras que el grupo experimental recibió un ciclo corto de quimioterapia con carboplatino y paclitaxel antes de comenzar el tratamiento estándar.
Los resultados del estudio fueron prometedores pues el 80% de las pacientes que recibieron el ciclo de quimioterapia inicial vivieron al menos cinco años más, y el 72% no experimentó una recaída ni propagación del cáncer. En comparación, en el grupo de control, el 72% sobrevivió al menos cinco años y el 64% no sufrió una recaída. Cáncer de cuello uterino iStock A pesar de los beneficios, muchos pacientes experimentaron efectos secundarios como fatiga, problemas gastrointestinales e infecciones. El 59% del grupo que recibió quimioterapia inicial sufrió eventos adversos graves, en comparación con el 48% del grupo de quimiorradioterapia sola.
Los investigadores destacan que este es el primer estudio aleatorizado de fase tres que muestra una "ventaja significativa en la supervivencia" al utilizar quimioterapia antes de la quimiorradioterapia , lo que representa una "mejora clínicamente significativa" a un "costo relativamente bajo".
La Dra. Mary McCormack, del University College Hospital y autora principal del estudio, afirmó que “ se trata de la mayor mejora en los resultados de esta enfermedad en más de 20 años. Estoy increíblemente orgullosa de todas las pacientes que participaron en el ensayo ”.
(Vea también: Las 4 infecciones que son comunes, pero podrían causarle cáncer ) Cáncer de cuello uterino iStock El cáncer de cuello uterino, que alguna vez fue la principal causa de muerte por cáncer entre mujeres en EE.UU., si gue siendo un problema grave, con unas 4.000 muertes al año. Brawley, profesor de oncología en la Universidad Johns Hopkins, subraya la importancia de las pruebas de cribado regulares, que pueden detectar el virus del papiloma humano (HPV), un factor de riesgo significativo para esta enfermedad.
Este año, la FDA aprobó una opción de autocolecta para la detección del HPV, facilitando el proceso de cribado. Brawley enfatiza que, gracias a la vacuna contra el HPV y las pruebas de detección, el cáncer de cuello uterino es casi totalmente prevenible.
Mientras que la quimioterapia puede conllevar efectos secundarios difíciles, los expertos esperan que el futuro del tratamiento incluya opciones más personalizadas, como la inmunoterapia, que utiliza el sistema inmunitario del paciente para combatir el cáncer. “La mayor esperanza es la inmunoterapia”, concluyó Brawley, “y aspiramos a ayudar a más mujeres con menos efectos secundarios”.
(Vea más: Cómo era la enfermedad terminal por la que murió el excandidato Rodolfo Hernández ) Preocupación por la implementación de la Jurisdicción Agraria y Rural en Colombia Destacados

author: @PublimetroMX
title: Grecia Benavides propone que Impuesto Verde se aplique para mejorar calidad del aire - Publimetro México
text:
La diputada Grecia Benavides, del Grupo Legislativo de Morena, presentó una iniciativa para garantizar que lo recaudado por el llamado Impuesto Verde en Nuevo León sea utilizado exclusivamente en acciones de mitigación y remediación ambiental.
Desde su implementación en 2021, el Impuesto Verde busca que las industrias contaminantes contribuyan a la reparación del daño ecológico en el Estado.
Sin embargo, la falta de reglas claras sobre la aplicación de estos recursos ha generado incertidumbre y ha limitado su impacto positivo.
“Estamos proponiendo en la Ley de Hacienda que este impuesto se utilice para acciones de remediación ambiental para que por ley lo que se recaude se tenga que utilizar en acciones para reducir y combatir la contaminación ambiental”, señaló Benavides.
La iniciativa propone reformar el capítulo Quinto de la Ley de Hacienda del Estado de Nuevo León, renombrándolo como “De los Impuestos Ecológicos para la Remediación Ambiental” y estableciendo que todos los ingresos obtenidos de este concepto sean destinados exclusivamente a proyectos de saneamiento ambiental.
¿Cuánto se ha recaudado?
Entre 2023 y 2024, el estado recaudó más de 3 mil millones de pesos en impuestos ecológicos, pero actualmente no existe la obligación por parte del Estado para destinar esos recursos al combate de la contaminación.
“La Ley no dice la finalidad de estos impuestos verdes. Se tiene que utilizar esos impuestos para combatir la contaminación, y debe escucharse a los expertos y expertas para definir las acciones en las que debe utilizarse lo recaudado”, destacó la legisladora.

author: Ariadna Eljuri
title: Fishing and aquaculture sector grew by 13% in 2023 - Últimas Noticias
text: The fishing and aquaculture sector registered a growth of 2023% in 13 compared to the data collected in 2022, indicated Minister Juan Carlos Loyo. Through his account on the social network ) to aquaculture production. Regarding fishing catch, in 2023 a growth of 25% was recorded compared to the previous year. This variable was affected by the sardine fishery, which registered an increase of 78%. “With the implementation of the Sardine Micro Mission for the sustainable Fishing of this important resource,” Loyo wrote on the social network. The seafood products that recorded the most growth are: sardines with 81.156 tons; white shrimp with 6.662 tons; lake curbina with 2.621 tons, octopus with 2.562 tons, striped catfish with 3.026 tons; and the baldric with 5.451 tons; among others. On the other hand, aquaculture production grew by 20%, with the main factor of this variation being the production of the shrimp sector, which registered an increase of 27%. In this area, the products that registered the most growth are: shrimp with 38.082 tons; macroalgae with 596 tons and tilapia with 27,43 tons. In shrimp alone, the minister detailed, there has been a 98% increase in exports, after the reinvigoration of the Bolivarian Economic Agenda in 2018. In addition to shrimp, the minister indicated, exports of Tahalí (38%), Seaweed (7%), Curbina (14%) grew. “The record of the Octopus season with a shocking growth of 3.946%,” he stressed. More than 130.000 tons of seafood distributed nationwide In the balance, Minister Juan Carlos Loyo highlighted the national distribution carried out in 2023. Specifically, through different policies, 133.555 tons of seafood were distributed. Likewise, 12 Shoal Fairs were held, serving 344.787 families, with the sale of 753.840 tons of seafood products.
